p: Worldwide, NoVs are the leading cause of AGE outbreaks. Such outbreaks often occur in healthcare facilities, restaurants, cruise ships and institutional settings and have commonly drawn the attention of society. GII.4 has been successfully persistent, with periodic emergence over the past two decades worldwide (GII.4 US95/96 in 1995, GII.4 Farmington Hills in 2002, GII.4 Hunter in 2004, GII.4 Den Haag in 2006, GII.4 New Orleans in 2009, and GII.4 Sydney in 2012) [ 27]. However, our study focused on the occurrence of non-GII.4 NoVs and the important role of these NoVs in AGE outbreaks in Jinan, China.
